abstract.t: Georgetown University is designing a Learning Resource Center (LRC), part of which may consist of a system to enable computer query (hopefully on-line) of G.U.'s Library holdings. The ARPA community might be of assistance in either of two ways:
1. One or more organizations may have a Library Retrieval System that they would like to share with Georgetown

2. Since there probably are needs for such a system at most organizations, and since it would be highly beneficial for one organization to be able to query other library holdings as well, and subsequently arrange for inter-library loans, the ARPA community might undertake to design a Network Library Information System.
If sufficient interest in such a system exists, a working group could be set up to establish the necessary protocols and iron out details of the system.
